review.title: Performance Analysis of Enhanced Clustering Algorithm for Gene Expression Data
review.abstract: Microarrays are made it possible to simultaneously monitor the expression profiles of thousands of genes under various experimental conditions. It is used to identify the co-expressed genes in specific cells or tissues that are actively used to make proteins. This method is used to analysis the gene expression, an important task in bioinformatics research. Cluster analysis of gene expression data has proved to be a useful tool for identifying co-expressed genes, biologically relevant groupings of genes and samples. In this paper we applied K-Means with Automatic Generations of Merge Factor for ISODATA- AGMFI. Though AGMFI has been applied for clustering of Gene Expression Data, this proposed Enhanced Automatic Generations of Merge Factor for ISODATA- EAGMFI Algorithms overcome the drawbacks of AGMFI in terms of specifying the optimal number of clusters and initialization of good cluster centroids. Experimental results on Gene Expression Data show that the proposed EAGMFI algorithms could identify compact clusters with perform well in terms of the Silhouette Coefficients cluster measure.

sections.heading: Steps:
sections.text: Usually, we select k data points from D as initial centrifuges; 2. repeat assigning each point di to the cluster that has the tightest centrifuge; calculate the new mean for each cluster; Until convergence criteria are met. Although the K-Means algorithm is simple, it has some drawbacks to the quality of the final clustering, as it depends heavily on the arbitrary selection of the initial centrifuges [1].2.2 Automatic generation of merge factors for ISODATA (AGMFI) algorithms generated in the K-Means clustering are further optimized by the ISODATA algorithm. Some of the parameters are fixed by the user during the merging and partitioning of the clusters. In [10], the automatic generation of merge factors is suggested to initialize the merge factor _ for ISODATA _ _ MAGFI to determine when the splitting occurs.

sections.heading: Steps:
sections.text: 1. In the given dataset D, if the data points contain both positive and negative attribute values, then go to step 2, otherwise go to step 4. 2. Find the minimum attribute value in the given dataset D. 3. Subtract the minimum attribute value for each data point attribute. 4. Calculate the distance from the origin for each data point. 5. Sort the distances obtained in step 4. 6. Sort the data points according to the distances. 9. Repeat the sorted data points in k the same records. 7. In each set, take the center as the initial center point. 8. Calculate the distance between each data point di (1 ≤ i ≤ n) to all initial centering cj (1 ≤ j ≤ k). 9. Search for each data point di the closest center cj and assign di the cluster j _ _ zentrid [i] = j.

sections.heading: Serum data
sections.text: This dataset is described and used in [10] and can be downloaded from: http: / / www.sciencemag.org / feature / data / 984559.shl and corresponds to the selection of 517 genes whose expression varies according to serum concentration in human fibroblasts.

sections.heading: Yeast data
sections.text: This dataset contains 2884 genes and 17 conditions. To avoid distortion or distortion due to missing values in the data matrix, we remove all genes that had a missing value. This step results in a matrix of size 2882 * 17.

sections.heading: Simulated data
sections.text: It is downloaded from http: / / www.igbmc.ustrasbg.fr / projet s / fcm / y3c.txt and contains 300 genes [3]. Above the microarray data set, all values in each gene mean zero and standard deviation equal to 1 are normalized. 4.1 Comparative Analyses K-Means, Enhanced with K-Means, and AGMFI are applied to serum data when the number of clusters is 10 and 5 times after EAGMFI cluster data in 7.K-Means, Enhanced with K-Means, and AGMFI are applied to yeast data sets when the number of clusters is 34 and 5 times after EAGMFI cluster data in 18. K-Means, Enhanced with K-Means, and AGMFI are applied to simulated data sets when the number of clusters is 10 and 5 times after EMAGI clusters are initialized.

sections.heading: 5. Conclusion
sections.text: The Enhanced Automatic Generation of Merge Factor for ISODATA (EAGMFI) Clustering Microarray Data based on K-Means and AGMFI clustering algorithms have also been investigated. One of the disadvantages of AGMFI is the random selection of the starting point of the desired clusters, which has been overcome with Enhanced for Finding the initial centroids algorithms to avoid for initial values at random. Therefore, the EAGMFI algorithm is independent of the choice of the number of clusters and the automatic evaluation of the starting point of the centroids it generates with Silhouette coefficient measurement, with different better results.
